text.p: Here are highlights of stories in Romania's press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy:
- Romania signed the accord to join the Central European Free Trade Association. The accord will become effective on July 1.
- The government plans to put the State Ownership Fund under its control.
- The local leu currency will apreciate against the dollar soon, Finance Minister Mircea Ciumara said.
- The government will start talks on amendments to the law on foreign investment.

- Trade union leaders from the Petromidia SA refinery, which the government plans to close down as part of a restructuring project, will start talks with the government in a bid to prevent Petromidia's closure.
- Unindentified persons destroyed some 80 tombs in an Orthodox cemetery in the Transylvanian city of Cluj.
- President Emil Constantinescu will meet leaders of the leftist opposition to discuss ways to secure their support in parliament for the approval of vital laws for the reforms.
- Prosecutors started investigations in the case of a group of magistrates in the Vilcea county allegedly involved in illegal adoptions.
